elements.text:
So the amounts make sense, if I look at this bit. It seems that this tx had a burn of 2400 CC. So that's how we get 7400-2400=5000 CC actual balance change (look at the wallet UI). Funny how the event itself does not contain this 5023 value anywhere, its just derived from these fields.

What remains a question is how traffic purchase actually works and how this affects our rewards calculations.
I know, that a certain amount of traffic is free, and after an amount, the validator has to purchase it. So this seems like one of those purchases, and that it can use the AppRewardCoupons to do that.

text: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WgI0qP8REYD36MyLcY8RmOa0DlXs0RQLvn2yBDJTQEw/edit?tab=t.0>

```Hello Meria team, @loic_meria   FYI, 

After a week or two of getting pulled away to manage the Canton Featured App rewards, we're back on track and very close to starting the onboarding process to support our CBTC token on Canton!

We will start in Testnet. We have put together some files which can help answer some onboarding questions. These include a script for ensuring your Testnet environment and networking are set up correctly, as well as for creating a party and a user. Please pull these files down, review the readme and let us know if you have questions.

<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1VwOPpyIIlVBbzOc6w0g1c2UlcmU15slN>

Although we are starting in Testnet, you can also run this script in Mainnet to confirm things are correct there as well.

We would like to start the onboarding process in the next one or two days! Let us know how it goes running the prerequisites script above and thanks for your support```

elements.text:
Hello Meria team, @loic_meria   FYI, 

After a week or two of getting pulled away to manage the Canton Featured App rewards, we're back on track and very close to starting the onboarding process to support our CBTC token on Canton!

We will start in Testnet. We have put together some files which can help answer some onboarding questions. These include a script for ensuring your Testnet environment and networking are set up correctly, as well as for creating a party and a user. Please pull these files down, review the readme and let us know if you have questions.

Although we are starting in Testnet, you can also run this script in Mainnet to confirm things are correct there as well.

We would like to start the onboarding process in the next one or two days! Let us know how it goes running the prerequisites script above and thanks for your support

text:
This is interesting. I’m tweaking our Denex Gas Station app settings, and I needed to deposit some CC into it. I clicked a link and it auto-populated this form!

Here was the URL I landed on to see this page:

```<https://wallet-ibtc-mainnet.console.canton.ibtc.network/confirm-payment/00b28d047b648788095331c4c841ba414335aa3fc436a8eaa8a193ecc6996601caca111220fdf798c3c93d8379f3e48035b9d5603489a50e1b3306fb00574f3bfa47a4f8ca/?redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fdenex.io%3FcameFrom%3Dwallet>```
I’m not sure what’s inside that hex to have caused this, but it’s pretty neat. In theory we could use that for our customers to more easily do top-ups and submit payments.
